title: Waqf Symbols
desc1_desc: This guide explains the different types of Waqf signs in the Quran, highlighting their meanings and usage during recitation.

types.name: Mandatory Stop
types.rule: You must stop when you see this sign.

example.text: إِنَّمَا يَسْتَجِيبُ الَّذِينَ يَسْمَعُونَ وَٱلْمَوْتَىٰ يَبْعَثُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ يُرْجَعُونَ

types.name: Recommended Stop
types.rule: It is better to stop at this sign for smoother recitation.

example.text: وَإِذَا لَقِيتُمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فَضَرْبَ الرِّقَابِ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَثْخَنتُمُوهُمْ فَشُدُّوا ٱلْوَثَاقَ فَإِمَّا مَنًّا بَعْدُ وَإِمَّا فِدَاءً

types.name: Optional Stop or Continuation
types.rule: You may choose to stop or continue at this sign based on your preference.

example.text: لَا يُكَلِّفُ اللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسۡعَهَا لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيۡهَا مَا ٱكۡتَسَبَتْ

types.name: Recommended Continuation
types.rule: It is better to continue without stopping at this sign.

example.text: وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ الَّذِينَ قُتِلُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ أَمْوَاتًا بَلْ أَحْيَاءٌ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ يُرْزَقُونَ

types.name: Mandatory Continuation
types.rule: Stopping is prohibited at this sign, and you must continue reciting.

types.name: Stop at One, Not Both
types.rule: It is preferable to stop at one of these signs but avoid stopping at both.

example.text: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْكِتَابُ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ هُدًى لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ

details.meaning: Found at the end of a verse or on the side of the Quran page, it marks divisions within the Quran known as Ruku' (ركوع).
details.purpose: These sections, around 540 in total, are often used as convenient stopping points during Salah (prayer).

additional_info.description: Each Ruku' usually contains 3-10 verses and helps organize the Quran for easier recitation management.

summary.Ruku' Sign: The 'ع' sign shows where to end a recitation session conveniently.

Quizs.question: The verse above has a sign that indicates that the reciter...
Which signs indicate the reciter should stop at one sign but not both?
Select the sign that indicates the reciter is better to stop.
How should this type of stop sign be recited?

answers.answer: Better to stop in one sign, but not both

Quizs.question: Choose the correct example which has the sign indicating the reciter must continue.

answers.answer: إِلَّا ٱمۡرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرۡنَآ ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ ٱلۡغَٰبِرِينَ ◯
وَقَالُواْ كُونُواْ هُودًا أَوۡ نَصَٰرَىٰ تَهۡتَدُوا۟ ۗ قُلۡ بَلۡ مِلَّةَ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ حَنِيفًا ◯
وَلَا تَعَاوَنُواْ عَلَى ٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡعُدۡوَٰنِ ۖ وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ ◯
لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفۡسًا إِلَّا وُسۡعَهَا ۚ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتۡ وَعَلَيۡهَا مَا ٱكۡتَسَبَتۡ ◯

Quizs.question: Which of the following examples indicates a better continuation?

answers.answer: وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ الَّذِينَ قُتِلُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ◯
